alert.note: Alert for Dubuque (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 28 at 4:07AM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Missouri...Illinois... Mississippi River at Keokuk LD19 affecting Lee, Clark and Hancock Counties. Mississippi River at Gregory Landing, Keithsburg, New Boston LD17, Muscatine, Ill. City LD16, Rock Island LD15, Le Claire LD14, Fulton LD13, Bellevue LD12 , Camanche, Burlington, Gladstone LD18, Dubuque LD11, Dubuque, and Keokuk LD19. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR THE FAILURE OF THE DAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Dubuque LD11. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, water affects Volunteer Drive leading to Lock and Dam 11. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM CDT Friday, the stage was 22.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23.1 feet just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued later this morning.
